meanings.definition: A person or institution appointed by a testator to carry out the terms of their will.
meanings.sent1: The executors of the will made sure all the wishes were followed.
meanings.sent2: The executors distributed the assets according to the instructions in the will.
meanings.sent3: The executors threw a party to celebrate successfully fulfilling the will's requirements.
meanings.sent4: The executors were like diligent detectives, uncovering and executing each detail of the will.
meanings.sent5: The executors were the guardians of the testator's final wishes, ensuring they were honored.

meanings.definition: A person who carries out a task or duty.
meanings.sent1: The diligent executors completed the project ahead of schedule.
meanings.sent2: The executors of the plan ensured everything ran smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The executors joked that they were the superheroes of task completion.
meanings.sent4: The executors were the unsung heroes behind the scenes, making things happen.
meanings.sent5: The executors were like the gears in a well-oiled machine, keeping everything moving forward.

meanings.definition: A computer program or process that performs a specific function.
meanings.sent1: The software executors handled the data processing efficiently.
meanings.sent2: The executors of the program ran seamlessly in the background.
meanings.sent3: The executors in the system had a virtual meeting to discuss their tasks.
meanings.sent4: The executors were like digital assistants, carrying out tasks with precision.
meanings.sent5: The executors were the silent workers in the digital realm, ensuring operations ran smoothly.
